params.text:
Pest Management

Specifically, the following are the recommended practices to control pests and diseases of squash:

  • Practice Integrated Pest Management (IPM) in squash production.

  • Plant only the healthy seedlings, free from insect pests and diseases.

  • Use varieties that are resistant to pests and diseases such as leaf mosaic virus and leaf curl virus.

  • Â Practice clean culture or good sanitation.

  • Uproot weeds immediately as they occur in the production area. Weeds harbor insect pests and diseases; and compete for the absorption of sunlight, nutrient elements, and space.
